sen.j: おけさ号（おけさごう）は、大阪府大阪市北区 (大阪市)から京都府京都市下京区を経由して新潟県新潟市中央区 (新潟市)とを結ぶ高速バス路線の愛称である。
sen.e: Okesa is an unofficial name given to an express bus service that connects Kita Ward, Osaka City in Osaka Prefecture (Osaka City) and Chuo Ward, Niigata City in Niigata Prefecture (Niigata City), running through Shimogyo Ward, Kyoto City in Kyoto Prefecture.
sen.cmt: (大阪市)、(新潟市)は誤って挿入されていると思われますが、原文どうり訳しました。
sen.e: Okesa-go is an unofficial name given to an express bus service that connects Kita Ward, Osaka City in Osaka Prefecture (Osaka City) and Chuo Ward, Niigata City in Niigata Prefecture (Niigata City), running through Shimogyo Ward, Kyoto City in Kyoto Prefecture.

Okesa-go is an unofficial name given to an express bus service that connects Kita Ward, Osaka City in Osaka Prefecture (Osaka City) and Chuo Ward, Niigata City in Niigata Prefecture (Niigata City), running through Shimogyo Ward, Kyoto City in Kyoto Prefecture.

sen.j: 概要
sen.e: Summary
Summary
Summary

sen.j: 1日あたり夜行1往復を運行。
sen.e: This service provides a overnight round-trip once a day.
This service provides a overnight round-trip once a day.
This service provides a overnight round-trip once a day.

sen.j: 週末や多客期には続行便が運行されることがある。
sen.e: Extra busses could run during weekends and busy seasons.
Extra busses could run during weekends and busy seasons.
Extra busses could run during weekends and busy seasons.

sen.j: 2005年7月28日から2007年10月28日までは昼行便1往復も運行されていた。
sen.e: Between 28 July, 2005 and 28 October, 2007, this route also offered a daytime round-trip once a day.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Between 28 July, 2005 and 28 October, 2007, this route also offered a daytime round-trip once a day.
Between 28 July, 2005 and 28 October, 2007, this route also offered a daytime round-trip once a day.

sen.j: だが、それは廃止された。
sen.e: But, it was discontinued.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: But, it was discontinued.
But, it was discontinued.

Hankyu Bus Co., Ltd. (Toyonaka transportation office, Hankyu Bus Co., Ltd.)
Hankyu Bus Co., Ltd. (Toyonaka transportation office, Hankyu Bus Co., Ltd.)

sen.j: 新潟交通（新潟東部営業所）

Niigata Kotsu Co., Ltd. (East Nigata transportation office)

sen.j: 停車停留所
sen.e: Bus stations and stops
Bus stations and stops
Bus stations and stops

sen.j: ▼…梅田発は乗車のみ、新潟発は降車のみ扱い
sen.e: ▼ indicates that busses departing from Umeda stop here for boarding only; those departing from Niigata for alighting only.

The Busses departing from Umeda stop at Shin-Osaka/Senri New Town/Senri Chuo/Meishin Ibaragi/Maishin Takatsuki/Maishin Oyamazaki/Karasuma Exit of Kyoto Station/Kyoto Shin-Hankyu Hotel/Kyoto Fukakusa for boarding only; those departing from Niigata for alighting only.
sen.cmt: 記号削除し、訂正しました。Webを参照し、停車駅を補足しました「新大阪・千里ニュータウン・千里中央・名神茨木・茨木市・名神高槻・名神大山崎・京都駅前（烏丸口）・京都新阪急ホテル前・京都深草 」
sen.e: The Busses departing from Umeda stop at Shin-Osaka/Senri New Town/Senri Chuo/Meishin Ibaragi/Maishin Takatsuki/Maishin Oyamazaki/Karasuma Exit of Kyoto Station/Kyoto Shin-Hankyu Hotel/Kyoto Fukakusa for boarding only; those departing from Niigata for alighting only.

sen.j: ▲…新潟発は乗車のみ、梅田発は降車のみ扱い
sen.e: ▲ indicates that busses departing from Niigata stop here for boarding only; those departing from Umeda for alighting only.

The busses departing from Niigata stop at Sanjotsubame/Makikata Higashi/Toppara/Niigata Prefectural office/City office/Furumachi/Bandai Exit of Niigata Station/Bandai City Bus Center for boarding only; those departing from Umeda for alighting only.
sen.cmt: 記号削除し、訂正しました。Webを参照し、停車駅を補足しました「三条燕・巻潟東・鳥原・県庁東・市役所前・古町・新潟駅前（万代口）・万代シテイバスセンター 」
sen.e: The busses departing from Niigata stop at Sanjotsubame/Makikata Higashi/Toppara/Niigata Prefectural office/City office/Furumachi/Bandai Exit of Niigata Station/Bandai City Bus Center for boarding only; those departing from Umeda for alighting only.

sen.j: ▽…万代シテイバスセンター前：梅田発のみ停車、降車のみ扱い
sen.e: ▽ indicates that here at Bandai City Bus Center-mae, only busses departing from Umeda stop for alighting.
The busses departing from Umeda stop for alighting at Bandai City Bus Center
sen.cmt: 記号削除し、訂正しました。
sen.e: The busses departing from Umeda stop for alighting at Bandai City Bus Center

sen.j: ＃…休憩停車を行うパーキングエリア
sen.e: ＃ indicates rest areas where buses take rest stops.
The rest areas where buses take rest stops at are Kusatsu Parking Area and Saiae Parking Area.
sen.cmt: 記号削除し、訂正しました。Webを参照し、停車駅を補足しました「草津パーキングエリア/栄パーキングエリア 」
sen.e: The rest areas where buses take rest stops at are Kusatsu Parking Area and Saiae Parking Area.

sen.j: 運行経路
sen.e: Route
Route
Route

sen.j: 国道423号- （吹田インターチェンジ） - 名神高速道路 - （京都南インターチェンジ） - 国道1号 - （京都南IC） - （米原ジャンクション） - 北陸自動車道 - （新潟西インターチェンジ） - 国道116号新潟バイパス・国道8号新潟バイパス - （女池インターチェンジ）
sen.e: National Route 423 - (Suita Interchange) - Meishin Expressway - (Kyoto Minami Interchange) - National Route 1 - (Kyoto Minami Interchange) - (Maibara Junction) - Hokuriku Expressway - (Niigatanishi Interchange) - National Route 116 Nigata Bypass, National Route 8 Nigata Bypass - (Meike Interchange)

National Route 423 - (Suita Interchange) - Meishin Expressway - (Kyoto Minami Interchange) - National Route 1 - (Kyoto Minami Interchange) - (Maibara Junction) - Hokuriku Expressway - (Niigatanishi Interchange) - National Route 116 Nigata Bypass, National Route 8 Nigata Bypass - (Meike Interchange)

National Route 423 - (Suita Interchange) - Meishin Expressway - (Kyoto Minami Interchange) - National Route 1 - (Kyoto Minami Interchange) - (Maibara Junction) - Hokuriku Expressway - (Niigatanishi Interchange) - National Route 116 Nigata Bypass, National Route 8 Nigata Bypass - (Meike Interchange)

sen.j: 乗客が下車できない乗務員交代の休憩場所は、阪急バスと新潟交通とでは異なる。
sen.e: Hankyu Bus and Niigata Kotsu busses stop at different places for crew changes, during which passengers are not allowed to get off.
Hankyu Bus and Niigata Kotsu busses stop at different places for crew changes, during which passengers are not allowed to get off.
Hankyu Bus and Niigata Kotsu busses stop at different places for crew changes, during which passengers are not allowed to get off.

sen.j: 阪急バスは、草津パーキングエリアを出発したら、南条サービスエリア・小矢部川サービスエリア・蓮台寺パーキングエリアの順に乗務員交代ならびに車両点検を行う。
sen.e: After departing from the Kusatsu Rest Area, busses operated by Hankyu Bus stop for crew changes and car maintenance at the Nanjo Rest Area, the Oyabegawa Rest Area, and then the Rendaiji Parking Area.

After departing from the Kusatsu Rest Area, busses operated by Hankyu Bus stop for crew changes and car maintenance at the Nanjo Rest Area, the Oyabegawa Rest Area, and then the Rendaiji Parking Area.

After departing from the Kusatsu Rest Area, busses operated by Hankyu Bus stop for crew changes and car maintenance at the Nanjo Rest Area, the Oyabegawa Rest Area, and then the Rendaiji Parking Area.

sen.j: 一方、新潟交通は草津パーキングエリアを出発したら南条サービスエリア・有磯海サービスエリアの2ヶ所である。
sen.e: On the other hand, after departing from the Kusatsu Rest Area, Niigata Kotsu busses make two stops at the Nanjo Rest Area and the Arisomi Service Area.
On the other hand, after departing from the Kusatsu Rest Area, Niigata Kotsu busses make two stops at the Nanjo Rest Area and the Arisomi Service Area.
On the other hand, after departing from the Kusatsu Rest Area, Niigata Kotsu busses make two stops at the Nanjo Rest Area and the Arisomi Service Area.

sen.j: 新潟交通のほうが1回交代休憩が少ない。
sen.e: Niigata Kotsu busses make stops for a crew change and rest one time fewer.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Niigata Kotsu busses make stops for a crew change and rest one time fewer.
Niigata Kotsu busses make stops for a crew change and rest one time fewer.

sen.j: そのため、朝の栄パーキングエリアでは阪急バスと混成便の時には、新潟交通便のほうが15分ほど先に到着して先に出発する。
sen.e: This enables Niigata Kotsu busses to arrive at and depart from the Sakae Parking Area 15 minutes earlier in the morning than Hankyu Bus vehicles.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処 「混成便」は新潟交通バスが1、2号車、阪急バスが3、4号車のようにして、二つの会社がバスを複数同時に運行していることを指していると思われますが、「おけさ号」は１日一便が常にこのように運行されているようですので、「混成便」ではないときはありません。そのため、「混成便の時には」は訳しませんでした。 http://www6.ocn.ne.jp/~a19064/2001-nenmatu.html http://74.125.153.132/search?q=cache:7u9Twq0ZltUJ:bus.hankyu.co.jp/highway/highway17.html+%E3%81%8A%E3%81%91%E3%81%95%E5%8F%B7%E3%80%80&cd=1&hl=ja&ct=clnk&gl=jp http://www.niigata-kotsu.co.jp/kengaikousoku/osaka.shtml
sen.e: This enables Niigata Kotsu busses to arrive at and depart from the Sakae Parking Area 15 minutes earlier in the morning than Hankyu Bus vehicles.
This enables Niigata Kotsu busses to arrive at and depart from the Sakae Parking Area 15 minutes earlier in the morning than Hankyu Bus vehicles.

sen.j: これは、新潟駅前や終点の万代シテイバスセンターでの混雑緩和目的の意味合いからである。
sen.e: This arrangement is made to mitigate congestion at Niigata-ekimae and the Bandai City Bus Center, the terminus.
This arrangement is made to mitigate congestion at Niigata-ekimae and the Bandai City Bus Center, the terminus.
This arrangement is made to mitigate congestion at Niigata-ekimae and the Bandai City Bus Center, the terminus.

sen.j: どちらの降車場も一般路線バスが頻繁に到着するため複数台まとめての到着が難しい。
sen.e: Route busses arrive at these bus stops at short intervals, which makes it difficult for multiple busses to stop these places at the same time.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Route busses arrive at these bus stops at short intervals, which makes it difficult for multiple busses to stop these places at the same time.
Route busses arrive at these bus stops at short intervals, which makes it difficult for multiple busses to stop these places at the same time.

sen.j: 特に終点となっているバスセンターの11～13番線（東港線沿いバスベイ）は他の県外線高速バスの降車場となっている。
sen.e: Express busses traveling from other prefectures also stop for alighting at the bus gates from 11 to 13 (on a bus parking lane on the Toko Route) at the City Bus Center, the terminus.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処 「特に」は訳出していません。「東港線」:定訳不明 http://bus.niigata-inet.or.jp/info_bt/941.html
sen.e: Express busses traveling from other prefectures also stop for alighting at the bus gates from 11 to 13 (on a bus parking lane on the Toko Route) at the City Bus Center, the terminus.
Express busses traveling from other prefectures also stop for alighting at the bus gates from 11 to 13 (on a bus parking lane on the Toko Route) at the City Bus Center, the terminus.

sen.j: その上、一般路線（附船町線）の停留所も兼ねている。
sen.e: In addition, other route busses (the Tsukefunecho Line) also stop there.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In addition, other route busses (the Tsukefunecho Line) also stop there.
In addition, other route busses (the Tsukefunecho Line) also stop there.

sen.j: こうしたことから、こうした時間調整を行っている。
sen.e: This situation necessitates the adjustment of the bus schedules.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: This situation necessitates the adjustment of the bus schedules.
This situation necessitates the adjustment of the bus schedules.

sen.j: この11～13番線は以前、他の一般路線（大野白根線、流通センター線）の始発地にもなっており、バスの発着が特に頻繁であった。
sen.e: Since other route busses (the Ono-Shirane Line and the Distribution Center Line) also used to start at the gates from 11 to 13, these were especially crowded with incoming and outgoing busses.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処 「流通センター線」:定訳不明
sen.e: Since other route busses (the Ono-Shirane Line and the Distribution Center Line) also used to start at the gates from 11 to 13, these were especially crowded with incoming and outgoing busses.
Since other route busses (the Ono-Shirane Line and the Distribution Center Line) also used to start at the gates from 11 to 13, these were especially crowded with incoming and outgoing busses.

sen.j: だが、両路線とも新潟市のオムニバスタウン事業の一環で2007年11月1日から運行経路を変更した。
sen.e: However, these routes were changed on November 1, 2007, as part of the Omnibus Town project, a scheme aiming to achieve comfortable transportation and living by taking full advantage of bus services.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処 http://www.mlit.go.jp/english/2006/i_road_transport_bureau/01_omnibustown/index.html
sen.e: However, these routes were changed on November 1, 2007, as part of the Omnibus Town project, a scheme aiming to achieve comfortable transportation and living by taking full advantage of bus services.
However, these routes were changed on November 1, 2007, as part of the Omnibus Town project, a scheme aiming to achieve comfortable transportation and living by taking full advantage of bus services.

sen.j: そのため、現在同箇所を使用するのは附船町線のみである。
sen.e: This makes the Tsukefunecho Line the only route using these stops.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: This makes the Tsukefunecho Line the only route using these stops.
This makes the Tsukefunecho Line the only route using these stops.

sen.j: 現在は廃止された昼行便の運行についての補足を示す。
sen.e: The following describes the daytime bus service which is now discontinued.
The following describes the daytime bus service which is now discontinued.
The following describes the daytime bus service which is now discontinued.

sen.j: 草津パーキングエリア・南条サービスエリア・呉羽パーキングエリア・米山サービスエリアで休憩を取っていた。
sen.e: The busses took rest stops at the Kusatsu Rest Area, the Nanjo Rest Area, the Kureha Parking Area, and the Yoneyama Rest Area.
sen.cmt: 「米山サービスエリア」:定訳不明
sen.e: The busses took rest stops at the Kusatsu Rest Area, the Nanjo Rest Area, the Kureha Parking Area, and the Yoneyama Rest Area.
The busses took rest stops at the Kusatsu Rest Area, the Nanjo Rest Area, the Kureha Parking Area, and the Yoneyama Rest Area.

sen.j: 大阪発は南条サービスエリアで、新潟発は呉羽パーキングエリアで25分の昼食休憩が設定されていた。
sen.e: The busses departing from Osaka took a 25-minute lunch break at the Nanjo Rest Area; those departing from Niigata at the Kureha Parking Area.
The busses departing from Osaka took a 25-minute lunch break at the Nanjo Rest Area; those departing from Niigata at the Kureha Parking Area.
The busses departing from Osaka took a 25-minute lunch break at the Nanjo Rest Area; those departing from Niigata at the Kureha Parking Area.

sen.j: 千里中央・名神茨木・京都駅前には立ち寄らなかった。
sen.e: They did not stop at Senri-chuo, Meishin-ibaraki, or Kyotoeki-mae.
They did not stop at Senri Chuo, Meishin Ibaragi, or Kyoto Station.
sen.cmt: Senri Chuo, Meishin Ibaragi, or Kyoto Station訂正しました。
sen.e: They did not stop at Senri Chuo, Meishin Ibaragi, or Kyoto Station.

September 29, 1988
September 29, 1988
September 29, 1988

sen.j: - 梅田・阪急三番街BT - 京都駅前 - 新潟駅前間で運行開始（夜行便1往復）。
sen.e: The service started to travel between the Hankyu Sanbangai Bus Terminal in Umeda Station, Kyotoeki-mae, and Niigataeki-mae (one overnight round-trip a day).
sen.cmt: 「梅田・阪急三番街BT」は「梅田駅内の阪急三番街BT」を指しているようですので、そのように訳しました。http://bus.hankyu.co.jp/map/0005.html 「新潟駅前」:定訳不明
sen.e: The service started to travel between the Hankyu Sanbangai Bus Terminal in Umeda Station, Kyoto Station, and Niigata Station (one overnight round-trip a day).
sen.cmt: Kyoto Station, and Niigata Station訂正しました。
sen.e: The service started to travel between the Hankyu Sanbangai Bus Terminal in Umeda Station, Kyoto Station, and Niigata Station (one overnight round-trip a day).

sen.j: - 万代シテイバスセンター乗り入れ開始。
sen.e: The service was extended to the Bandai City Bus Center.
The service was extended to the Bandai City Bus Center.
The service was extended to the Bandai City Bus Center.
December 21, 2001
December 21, 2001
December 21, 2001

sen.j: -名神茨木・名神高槻・名神大山崎・京都深草・三条燕・巻潟東・鳥原・県庁東の停車取扱い開始。
sen.e: Okesa started to stop at Meishin-ibaraki, Meishin Takatsuki, Meishin-Oyamazaki, Kyotofukakusa, Sanjotsubame, Maki-Katahigashi, Toppara, Kenchohigashi.

sen.e: Okesa-go started to stop at Meishin Ibaraki, Meishin Takatsuki, Meishin Oyamazaki, Kyoto Fukakusa, Sanjotsubame, Makikata Higashi, Toppara, Niigata Prefectural office.

sen.j: - 昼行便運行開始、昼行・夜行各1往復体制に。
sen.e: A daytime service started to provide two round-trips a day, one each during the day and night.
A daytime service started to provide two round-trips a day, one each during the day and night.
A daytime service started to provide two round-trips a day, one each during the day and night.
October 28, 2007

sen.j: - 昼行便が廃止。
sen.e: The daytime service was discontinued.

sen.e: Okesa again took on only a night bus service.

sen.j: 2008年4月に、長岡市より柏崎市・京都市・大阪市を経由して堺市へ行く線が新設された。
sen.e: April 2008 marked the opening of the route that connects Nagaoka City and Sakai City through Kashiwazaki City, Kyoto City, and Osaka City.

sen.j: これは堺・なんば・京都 - 柏崎・長岡線と呼ばれる。
sen.e: This route is called the Sakai - Nanba - Kyoto to Kashiwazaki - Nagaoka Route.
